VMware NSX for vSphere API documentation version 6.2.3

https://{nsxmanager}/api

Introduction

This manual, the NSX for vSphere API Guide, describes how to install, configure, monitor, and maintain the VMware® NSX system by using REST API requests.

Intended Audience

This manual is intended for anyone who wants to use REST API to programmatically control NSX in a VMware vSphere environment. The information in this manual is written for experienced developers who are familiar with virtual machine technology, virtualized datacenter operations, and REST APIs. This manual also assumes familiarity with NSX for vSphere.

VMware Technical Publications Glossary

VMware Technical Publications provides a glossary of terms that might be unfamiliar to you. For definitions of terms as they are used in VMware technical documentation go to http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs.

Document Feedback

VMware welcomes your suggestions for improving our documentation. If you have comments, send your feedback to docfeedback@vmware.com.

NSX Documentation

The following documents comprise the NSX documentation set:

  • NSX for vSphere Administration Guide
  • NSX for vSphere Installation and Upgrade
  • NSX API Programming Guide

Technical Support and Education Resources

The following sections describe the technical support resources available to you. To access the current version of this book and other books, go to http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs.

Online and Telephone Support

To use online support to submit technical support requests, view your product and contract information, and register your products, go to http://www.vmware.com/support.

Customers with appropriate support contracts should use telephone support for the fastest response on priority 1 issues. Go to http://www.vmware.com/support/phone_support.

Support Offerings

To find out how VMware support offerings can help meet your business needs, go to http://www.vmware.com/support/services.

VMware Professional Services

VMware Education Services courses offer extensive hands‐on labs, case study examples, and course materials designed to be used as on‐the‐job reference tools. Courses are available onsite, in the classroom, and live online. For onsite pilot programs and implementation best practices, VMware Consulting Services provides offerings to help you assess, plan, build, and manage your virtual environment. To access information about education classes, certification programs, and consulting services, go to http://www.vmware.com/services.

vdsManage

This collection of methods are used to configure and prepare the VDS's for the use with NSX. Before creating a logical switch, ensure that you have installed the network virtualization components on the appropriate clusters and that you have configured VXLAN on the appropriate clusters.

vdsManage /2.0/vdn/switches post get

post

The MTU is the maximum amount of data that can be transmitted in one packet before it is divided into smaller packets. The frames are slightly larger in size because of the traffic encapsulation, so the MTU required is higher than the standard MTU. You must set the MTU for each switch to 1600 or higher.

get

You can retrieve all configured switches.

post vdsManage /2.0/vdn/switches

The MTU is the maximum amount of data that can be transmitted in one packet before it is divided into smaller packets. The frames are slightly larger in size because of the traffic encapsulation, so the MTU required is higher than the standard MTU. You must set the MTU for each switch to 1600 or higher.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdsContext">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="switch">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="teaming"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<vdsContext>
  <switch>
    <objectId></objectId>
      <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
      </type>
      <name></name>
      <revision></revision>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  </switch>
  <teaming></teaming>
  <mtu></mtu>
</vdsContext>
Secured by basic

get vdsManage /2.0/vdn/switches

You can retrieve all configured switches.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<vdsContexts>
  <vdsContext>
    <switch>
      <objectId></objectId>
      <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
      </type>
      <name></name>
      <revision></revision>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    </switch>
    <teaming></teaming>
    <mtu></mtu>
  </vdsContext>
</vdsContexts>
Secured by basic

vdsInDc /datacenter/{datacenterID} get

You can retrieve all configured switches on a datacenter.

get

Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

get vdsInDc /2.0/vdn/switches/datacenter/{datacenterID}

Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • datacenterID: required (string)

    A valid Datacenter ID (e.g. datacenter-4)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<vdsContexts>
  <vdsContext>
    <switch>
      <objectId></objectId>
      <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
      </type>
      <name></name>
      <revision></revision>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    </switch>
    <teaming></teaming>
    <mtu></mtu>
  </vdsContext>
</vdsContexts>
Secured by basic

vds /{vdsId} get delete

Retrieve a specific switch by specific switch ID (e.g. dvs-26).

get

Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

delete

Delete a specific VDS by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-22). Use the switch ID as the vdsId.

get vds /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId}

Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • switchId: required (string)

    A valid switch (VDS) Id (e.g. dvs-26)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<vdsContext>
  <switch>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  </switch>
  <teaming></teaming>
  <mtu></mtu>
</vdsContext>
Secured by basic

delete vds /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId}

Delete a specific VDS by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-22). Use the switch ID as the vdsId.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • switchId: required (string)

    A valid switch (VDS) Id (e.g. dvs-26)

Secured by basic

vdnConfig

Configurations of Segment ID's and Multicast Ranges for logical switches

vdnSegmentPools /segments post get

You can specify one or more segment ID pools that is used to provide virtual network identifiers to logical switches which helps you isolate your network traffic.

post

You can add a new segment ID range that provides virtual network identifiers to logical switches. More than one segment ID range is supported in the system. The segment range is inclusive – the beginning and ending IDs are included.

get

Lists all Segment ID Pools.

post vdnSegmentPools /2.0/vdn/config/segments

You can add a new segment ID range that provides virtual network identifiers to logical switches. More than one segment ID range is supported in the system. The segment range is inclusive – the beginning and ending IDs are included.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • isUniversal: (boolean)

    Set to "true" when creating a universal VNI pool.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="segmentRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="begin"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<segmentRange>
  <name></name>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</segmentRange>
Secured by basic

get vdnSegmentPools /2.0/vdn/config/segments

Lists all Segment ID Pools.

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

vdnSegmentPool /{segmentPoolId} get put delete

Operations on individual segment ID Pool

get

Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool.

put

Update an individual segment ID Pool. If the segment pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

delete

Delete an individual segment ID Pool. If the segment pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

get vdnSegmentPool /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • segmentPoolId: required (string)

    A valid segment Pool Id

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<segmentRange>
  <id></id>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</segmentRange>
Secured by basic

put vdnSegmentPool /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Update an individual segment ID Pool. If the segment pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • segmentPoolId: required (string)

    A valid segment Pool Id

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="segmentRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<segmentRange>
  <end></end>
  <name></name>
</segmentRange>
Secured by basic

delete vdnSegmentPool /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Delete an individual segment ID Pool. If the segment pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • segmentPoolId: required (string)

    A valid segment Pool Id

Secured by basic

vdnMulticastPools /multicasts post get

Operations on multicast range Pools for logical switches. Specifying a multicast address range helps in spreading traffic across your network to avoid overloading a single multicast address.A virtualized network‐ready host is assigned an IP address from this range.

post

Adds a multicast range for logical switches. The address range is inclusive – the beginning and ending addresses are included.

get

List all configured VDN Multicast Pools. Universal pools will have the property isUniversal set tot true.

post vdnMulticastPools /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

Adds a multicast range for logical switches. The address range is inclusive – the beginning and ending addresses are included.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • isUniversal: (boolean)

    Set to "true" when creating a universal multicast range.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="multicastRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="desc"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="begin"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<multicastRange>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</multicastRange>
Secured by basic

get vdnMulticastPools /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

List all configured VDN Multicast Pools. Universal pools will have the property isUniversal set tot true.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<multicastRanges>
  <multicastRange>
    <id></id>
    <name></name>
    <desc></desc>
    <begin></begin>
    <end></end>
  </multicastRange>
</multicastRanges>
Secured by basic

vdnMulticastPool /{multicastAddresssRangeId} get put delete

Operations in individual multicast range Pools for logical switches

get

Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

put

Update an individual multicast range pool. If the multicast pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

delete

Delete an individual Multicast range pool. If the multicast pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

get vdnMulticastPool /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

    A valid multicast Pool range Id

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<multicastRange>
  <id></id>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</multicastRange>
Secured by basic

put vdnMulticastPool /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Update an individual multicast range pool. If the multicast pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

    A valid multicast Pool range Id

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="multicastRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="desc"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<multicastRange>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <end></end>
</multicastRange>
Secured by basic

delete vdnMulticastPool /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Delete an individual Multicast range pool. If the multicast pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

    A valid multicast Pool range Id

Secured by basic

vdnConfigUDP /vxlan/udp/port get

Managing the logical switch UDP port.

get

View configured UDP port for VXLAN.

get vdnConfigUDP /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port

View configured UDP port for VXLAN.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<int>4789</int>
Secured by basic

vdnConfigUDPUpdate /{portNumber} put

You can view the UDP port for VXLAN

put

You can change the UDP port for the logical switch. If not set, the port defaults to port 8472.

put vdnConfigUDPUpdate /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber}

You can change the UDP port for the logical switch. If not set, the port defaults to port 8472.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • portNumber: required (string)

    A valid UDP Port for VXLAN

Secured by basic

allocatedResources /resources/allocated get

Query allocated resources

get

Retrieve a list of resources allocated

get allocatedResources /2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated

Retrieve a list of resources allocated

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • type: (string)

    set to "segmentId" or "multicastAddress"

  • pagesize: (string)

    The pagesize parameter is an optional parameter that limits the maximum number of entries returned by the API. The default value for this parameter is 256 and the valid range is 1‐1024.

  • startindex: (string)

    The startindex parameter is an optional parameter which specifies the starting point for retrieving the resources. If this parameter is not specified, resources are retrieved from the beginning.

Secured by basic

vdnScopes

A network scope is the networking infrastructure within provider virtual datacenters. Read all scopes (transport zones), or create a new scope (Transport Zone).

vdnScopes /2.0/vdn/scopes get post

get

Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes / Transport Zones

post

Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ. You must specify the clusters that are to be part of the network scope. You must have the VLAN ID, UUID of the vCenter Server, and vDS ID.

get vdnScopes /2.0/vdn/scopes

Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes / Transport Zones

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<vdnScopes>
  <vdnScope>
    <objectId>vdnscope-1</objectId>
    <objectTypeName>VdnScope</objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid>4226CACF-0558-AFF3-5D92-279B201C40E2</vsmUuid>
    <nodeId>72eee9ab-bb75-49ba-a782-d7dffedd180a</nodeId>
    <revision>0</revision>
    <type>
      <typeName>VdnScope</typeName>
    </type>
    <name>tz-1</name>
    <description></description>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes/>
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    <id>vdnscope-1</id>
    <clusters>
      <cluster>
        <cluster>
          <objectId>domain-c21</objectId>
          <objectTypeName>ClusterComputeResource</objectTypeName>
          <vsmUuid>4226CACF-0558-AFF3-5D92-279B201C40E2</vsmUuid>
          <nodeId>72eee9ab-bb75-49ba-a782-d7dffedd180a</nodeId>
          <revision>10</revision>
          <type>
            <typeName>ClusterComputeResource</typeName>
          </type>
          <name>Cluster-1</name>
          <scope>
            <id>datacenter-2</id>
            <objectTypeName>Datacenter</objectTypeName>
            <name>Datacenter-1</name>
          </scope>
          <clientHandle></clientHandle>
          <extendedAttributes/>
          <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
          <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
        </cluster>
      </cluster>
    </clusters>
    <virtualWireCount>2</virtualWireCount>
    <controlPlaneMode>UNICAST_MODE</controlPlaneMode>
  </vdnScope>
</vdnScopes>
Secured by basic

post vdnScopes /2.0/vdn/scopes

Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ. You must specify the clusters that are to be part of the network scope. You must have the VLAN ID, UUID of the vCenter Server, and vDS ID.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • isUniversal: (boolean)

    Set to "true" when creating a universal transport zone.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdnScope">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="clusters">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="cluster">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="cluster">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="controlPlaneMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<vdnScope>
  <name></name>
  <clusters>
    <cluster>
      <cluster>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </cluster>
    </cluster>
  </clusters>
  <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
  <description></description>
</vdnScope>
Secured by basic

vdnScope /{scopeId} get post delete

Read, update and delete an existing scope (transport Zone)

get

Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

post

Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone.

delete

delete a transport zone

get vdnScope /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Secured by basic

post vdnScope /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Query Parameters

  • action: required (string)

    Mandatory queryParameter, use 'expand' to add a cluster, or 'shrink' to remove a cluster from the TZ

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdnScope">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="clusters">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="cluster">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="cluster">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<vdnScope>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <clusters>
    <cluster>
      <cluster>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </cluster>
    </cluster>
  </clusters>
</vdnScope>
Secured by basic

delete vdnScope /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

delete a transport zone

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Secured by basic

vdnScopeAttribUpdate /attributes put

update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

put

Update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

put vdnScopeAttribUpdate /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/attributes

Update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdnScope">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusters">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="cluster">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="cluster">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="controlPlaneMode"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<vdnScope>
  <clusters>
    <cluster>
      <cluster>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </cluster>
    </cluster>
  </clusters>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</vdnScope>
Secured by basic

vdnScopeConnCheck /conn-check/multicast post

Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

post

Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

post vdnScopeConnCheck /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/conn-check/multicast

Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<testParameters>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <packetSizeMode></packetSizeMode>
  <packetSize></packetSize>
  <sourceHost>
    <hostId></hostId>
    <switchId></switchId>
    <vlanId></vlanId>
  </sourceHost>
  <destinationHost>
    <hostId></hostId>
    <switchId></switchId>
    <vlanId></vlanId>
  </destinationHost>
</testParameters>
Secured by basic

logicalSwitches

Create and List operations of logical switches inside a Transport Zone.

logicalSwitches /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires get post

get

Lists all logical Switches in the Transport Zone (Scope)

post

Creates a logicalSwitch. To create a universal logical switch use the appropriate universal scope as the scopeId and use the primary NSX manager.

get logicalSwitches /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

Lists all logical Switches in the Transport Zone (Scope)

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Query Parameters

  • startIndex: (string - default: 0)

    An optional paramater that sets the starting point for listing logical switches

  • pageSize: (string - default: 20)

    An optional paramater that sets the number of entries returned. Range is 1-1024.

Secured by basic

post logicalSwitches /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

Creates a logicalSwitch. To create a universal logical switch use the appropriate universal scope as the scopeId and use the primary NSX manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    A valid scope Id

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="virtualWireCreateSpec">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="tenantId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="controlPlaneMode"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<virtualWireCreateSpec>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <tenantId></tenantId>
  <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</virtualWireCreateSpec>
Secured by basic

get

get logicalSwitchesGlobal /2.0/vdn/virtualwires

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • startIndex: (string - default: 0)

    Optional; specify starting point for retrieving logical switches

  • pageSize: (string - default: 20)

    Optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

Secured by basic

    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnicUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="portgroupId"/>

logicalSwitch /{virtualWireID} get put delete

Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

get

Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch. If the switch is a universal logical switch the isUniversal flag will be set in the response body.

put

Update a logical switch, possible updates are name changes & Controlplane Mode

delete

Delete a logical switch

get logicalSwitch /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch. If the switch is a universal logical switch the isUniversal flag will be set in the response body.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • virtualWireID: required (string)

    A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

Secured by basic

put logicalSwitch /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

Update a logical switch, possible updates are name changes & Controlplane Mode

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • virtualWireID: required (string)

    A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="virtualWire">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="tenantId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="controlPlaneMode"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<virtualWire>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <tenantId></tenantId>
  <vdnScopeId></vdnScopeId>
  <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</virtualWire>

logicalSwitchConnCheck /conn-check/multicast post

Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

post

Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

post logicalSwitchConnCheck /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/multicast

Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • virtualWireID: required (string)

    A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="testParameters">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="packetSizeMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="packetSize"/>
        <xs:element name="sourceHost">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="switchId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vlanId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="destinationHost">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="switchId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vlanId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<testParameters>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <packetSizeMode></packetSizeMode>
  <packetSize></packetSize>
  <sourceHost>
    <hostId></hostId>
    <switchId></switchId>
    <vlanId></vlanId>
  </sourceHost>
  <destinationHost>
    <hostId></hostId>
    <switchId></switchId>
    <vlanId></vlanId>
  </destinationHost>
</testParameters>
Secured by basic

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="packetSizeMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="packetSize"/>

              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>

            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>

              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="switchId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vlanId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  • Security

  • ID: required (string)

    dvpg MoID or virtual wire ID

Secured by basic

put arpMAC /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ID: required (string)

    dvpg MoID or virtual wire ID

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="networkFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ipDiscoveryConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="macLearningConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<networkFeatureConfig>
  <ipDiscoveryConfig>
    <enabled></enabled>
  </ipDiscoveryConfig>
  <macLearningConfig>
    <enabled></enabled>
  </macLearningConfig>
</networkFeatureConfig>
Secured by basic

nsxControllers

Working with NSX controllers - For the unicast or hybrid control plane mode, you must add an NSX controller to manage overlay transport and provide East-West routing. The controller optimizes virtual machine broadcast (ARP only) traffic, and the learning is stored on the host and the controller.

nsxControllers /2.0/vdn/controller post get

post

Adds a new NSX controller on the specified given cluster. The hostId parameter is optional. The resourcePoolId can be either the clusterId or resourcePoolId. The IP address of the controller node will be allocated from the specified IP pool. deployType determines the controller node memory size and can be small, medium, or large. However, different controller deployment types are not currently supported because the OVF overrides it and different OVF types require changes in the manager build scripts. Despite not being supported, an arbitrary deployType size must still be specified or an error will be returned. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster.

get

Retrieves details and runtime status for all controllers. Runtime status can be one of the following: Deploying ‐ controller is being deployed and the procedure has not completed yet. Removing ‐ controller is being removed and the procedure has not completed yet. Running ‐ controller has been deployed and can respond to API invocation. Unknown ‐ controller has been deployed but fails to respond to API invocation.

post nsxControllers /2.0/vdn/controller

Adds a new NSX controller on the specified given cluster. The hostId parameter is optional. The resourcePoolId can be either the clusterId or resourcePoolId. The IP address of the controller node will be allocated from the specified IP pool. deployType determines the controller node memory size and can be small, medium, or large. However, different controller deployment types are not currently supported because the OVF overrides it and different OVF types require changes in the manager build scripts. Despite not being supported, an arbitrary deployType size must still be specified or an error will be returned. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="controllerSpec">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourcePoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastoreId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="deployType"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="networkId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<controllerSpec>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <ipPoolId></ipPoolId>
  <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
  <hostId></hostId>
  <datastoreId></datastoreId>
  <deployType></deployType>
  <networkId></networkId>
  <password></password>
</controllerSpec>
Secured by basic

get nsxControllers /2.0/vdn/controller

Retrieves details and runtime status for all controllers. Runtime status can be one of the following: Deploying ‐ controller is being deployed and the procedure has not completed yet. Removing ‐ controller is being removed and the procedure has not completed yet. Running ‐ controller has been deployed and can respond to API invocation. Unknown ‐ controller has been deployed but fails to respond to API invocation.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<controllers>
  <controller>
    <id></id>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
    <status></status>
  </controller>
</controllers>
Secured by basic

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="syslogServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="level"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>

servicesScope

Working with services on a scope

servicesScope /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId} get post

get

List services that have been created on the scope

post

Create a new service on the specified scope

get servicesScope /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

List services that have been created on the scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

Secured by basic

post servicesScope /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

Create a new service on the specified scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="application">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:byte" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="element">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<application>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName/>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <element>
    <applicationProtocol>mandatory</applicationProtocol>
    <value>mandatory</value>
  </element>
</application>
Secured by basic

  • Security

    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

Type: application/xml

Schema:

  <xs:element name="application">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="element">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<application>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <element>
    <applicationProtocol></applicationProtocol>
    <value></value>
  </element>
</application>

delete service /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • applicationId: required (string)

    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean)

    Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

Secured by basic

applicationgroup

Operations on Application Groups

serviceGroups /scope/{scopeId} post get

Working with service groups

post

Create a new service group on the specified scope

get

Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

post serviceGroups /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}

Create a new service group on the specified scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    The scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<applicationGroup>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</applicationGroup>
Secured by basic

get serviceGroups /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}

Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    The scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

Secured by basic

serviceGroup /{applicationgroupId} get put delete

Working with an individual service group

get

Retrieve details about a service group

put

Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

delete

Delete a service group from a scope

get serviceGroup /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Retrieve details about a service group

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

    Application group ID

Secured by basic

put serviceGroup /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

    Application group ID

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<applicationGroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
  </member>
</applicationGroup>
Secured by basic

delete serviceGroup /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Delete a service group from a scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

    Application group ID

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean)

    Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

Secured by basic

ipPools

Create a pool of IP addresses

ipPools /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId} get post

get

Read all IP Pools in a scope

post

Create a pool of IP addresses

get ipPools /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

Read all IP Pools in a scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

Secured by basic

post ipPools /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

Create a pool of IP addresses

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipamAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixLength"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer1"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer2"/>
        <xs:element name="ipRanges">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipRangeDto">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startAddress"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="endAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipamAddressPool>
  <name></name>
  <prefixLength></prefixLength>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <startAddress></startAddress>
      <endAddress></endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>
Secured by basic

ipPool

Working with a specified IP pool

ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId} get put delete

get

Retrieve details about the IP pool

put

Modify an IP pool

delete

Delete an IP pool

get ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

Retrieve details about the IP pool

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • poolId: required (string)

    Specified IP pool

Secured by basic

put ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

Modify an IP pool

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • poolId: required (string)

    Specified IP pool

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipamAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixLength"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer1"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer2"/>
        <xs:element name="ipRanges">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipRangeDto">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startAddress"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="endAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipamAddressPool>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <prefixLength></prefixLength>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <id></id>
      <startAddress></startAddress>
      <endAddress></endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>
Secured by basic

  • Security

URI Parameters

    Specified IP pool

Secured by basic

ipPoolAllocate /ipaddresses get post

Work with IP's and their allocation status in IP Pools

get

Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

post

Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

get ipPoolAllocate /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • poolId: required (string)

    Specified IP pool

Secured by basic

post ipPoolAllocate /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • poolId: required (string)

    Specified IP pool

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressRequest">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="allocationMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipAddressRequest>
  <allocationMode></allocationMode>
  <ipAddress></ipAddress>
</ipAddressRequest>
Secured by basic

ipAddressRelease /{ipAddress} delete

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

delete

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

delete ipAddressRelease /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress}

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • poolId: required (string)

    Specified IP pool

  • ipAddress: required (string)

    The Id of the ip address to release, e.g. '192.168.10.10'

Secured by basic

capacityUsage

The licensing capacity usage API command reports usage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

capacityUsage /2.0/services/licensing/capacityusage get

get

Read capacity usage information on the useage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

get capacityUsage /2.0/services/licensing/capacityusage

Read capacity usage information on the useage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<featureCapacityUsageList>
  <featureCapacityUsageInfo>
    <capacityUsageInfo>
      <capacityType></capacityType>
      <usageCount></usageCount>
    </capacityUsageInfo>
    <feature></feature>
  </featureCapacityUsageInfo>
</featureCapacityUsageList>
Secured by basic

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityTag">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<securityTag>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
</securityTag>

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

post ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Register NSX Manager to SSO Services

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ssoConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoLookupServiceUrl"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUserpassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ssoConfig>
  <ssoLookupServiceUrl></ssoLookupServiceUrl>
  <ssoAdminUsername></ssoAdminUsername>
  <ssoAdminUserpassword></ssoAdminUserpassword>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
</ssoConfig>

  • Security

Secured by basic

userRoleMgmt /role/{userId} get post put delete

Manage roles for users

get

Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

post

Add role and resources for a user

put

Change a user's role

delete

Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

get userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    user to retrieve role information from

Secured by basic

post userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Add role and resources for a user

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    user to retrieve role information from

Query Parameters

  • isGroup: required (boolean)

    Set to "true" to apply to a group; set to "false" to apply to an individual user

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>
Secured by basic

put userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Change a user's role

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    user to retrieve role information from

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>
Secured by basic

delete userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    user to retrieve role information from

  • Security

URI Parameters

  • value: required (integer)

    value can be 0 to disable, or 1 to enable
