secGroup

Operations on securitygroups

secGroupBulk /bulk/{scopeId} post put

Create a new security group on a global scope or universal scope. Use either "globalroot-0" or "universalroot-0". Universal security groups are read-only when querying a secondary NSX manager.

post

Create a new security group on a global scope

put

Update a specific security group

post secGroupBulk /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

Create a new security group on a global scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    For the scopeId use globalroot-0 for non-universal security groups and universalroot-0 for universal security groups.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                    <xs:element name="dynamicCriteria">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </member>
  <excludeMember>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>
Secured by basic

put secGroupBulk /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

Update a specific security group

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    For the scopeId use globalroot-0 for non-universal security groups and universalroot-0 for universal security groups.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                    <xs:element name="dynamicCriteria">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes/>
  </member>
  <excludeMember>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>
Secured by basic

secGroupScope /scope/{scopeId} get

Operations to list information about security groups on a given scope

get

List all the security groups created on a specific scope

get secGroupScope /2.0/services/securitygroup/scope/{scopeId}

List all the security groups created on a specific scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterID / portgroupID in upgrade use cases

Secured by basic

secGroupMemberTypes /memberTypes get

Information on valid elements that can be added to a security group

get

Retrieve a list of valid elements that can be added to a security group.

get secGroupMemberTypes /2.0/services/securitygroup/scope/{scopeId}/memberTypes

Retrieve a list of valid elements that can be added to a security group.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterID / portgroupID in upgrade use cases

Secured by basic

secGroupScopeMemberByType /members/{memberType} get

Retrieve members of a specific type under a scope

get

Retrieve members of a specific type under a scope

get secGroupScopeMemberByType /2.0/services/securitygroup/scope/{scopeId}/members/{memberType}

Retrieve members of a specific type under a scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterID / portgroupID in upgrade use cases

  • memberType: required (string)

    Specific member type

Secured by basic

secGroupObject /{objectId} get put delete

Operations for an individual security group

get

Retrieve all members of the specified security group

put

Update members of the specified security group

delete

Delete an existing security group

get secGroupObject /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Retrieve all members of the specified security group

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Specified security group

Secured by basic

put secGroupObject /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Update members of the specified security group

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Specified security group

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isUniversal"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <isUniversal></isUniversal>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</securitygroup>
Secured by basic

delete secGroupObject /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Delete an existing security group

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Specified security group

Query Parameters

  • force: required (boolean)
Secured by basic

secGroupMember /members/{memberMoref} put delete

Operations on members of an individual security group

delete

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Specified security group

  • memberMoref: required (string)

    Security group member

Secured by basic

delete secGroupMember /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}/members/{memberMoref}

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Specified security group

  • memberMoref: required (string)

    Security group member

Secured by basic

Secured by basic

secGroupInternal /internal/scope/{scopeId} get

Information on internal security groups

get

Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

get secGroupInternal /2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId}

Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    Specified transport zone (scope)

Secured by basic

ipsets

Operations on IP Sets

ipsetList /scope/{scopeMoref} get

get

Retrieve all configured IPSets

get ipsetList /2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref}

Retrieve all configured IPSets

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeMoref: required (string)

    For scopeMoref use "globalroot-0" for non-universal IP sets and use "universalroot-0" for universal IP sets.

Secured by basic

ipsetCreate /{scopeMoref} post

post

creates a new IPset

post ipsetCreate /2.0/services/ipset/{scopeMoref}

creates a new IPset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeMoref: required (string)

    For scopeMoref use "globalroot-0" for non-universal IP sets and use "universalroot-0" for universal IP sets.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</ipset>
Secured by basic

ipset /{ipsetId} get put delete

get

Retrieve an individual IPset

put

Modify an existing IPset

delete

delete an IPset

get ipset /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

Retrieve an individual IPset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ipsetId: required (string)

    The IPset to be queried or changed

Secured by basic

put ipset /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

Modify an existing IPset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ipsetId: required (string)

    The IPset to be queried or changed

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</ipset>
Secured by basic

delete ipset /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

delete an IPset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ipsetId: required (string)

    The IPset to be queried or changed

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean)

    Set to "true" when forcing the removal of an IP set.

Secured by basic

vCenterConfig

Configuring NSX Manager with vCenter Server

vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig get put

get

Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

put

Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

get vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig

Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

put vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig

Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vcInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="assignRoleToUser"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pluginDownloadServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pluginDownloadPort"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<vcInfo>
  <ipAddress></ipAddress>
  <userName></userName>
  <password></password>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
  <assignRoleToUser></assignRoleToUser>
  <pluginDownloadServer></pluginDownloadServer>
  <pluginDownloadPort></pluginDownloadPort>
</vcInfo>
Secured by basic

  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nsxManagerInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerIp"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isPrimary"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<nsxManagerInfo>
  <nsxManagerIp></nsxManagerIp>
  <nsxManagerUsername></nsxManagerUsername>
  <nsxManagerPassword></nsxManagerPassword>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
  <isPrimary></isPrimary>

dns /dns put delete

Configure DNS

put

Configure DNS

delete

Delete DNS servers

put dns /1.0/appliance-management/system/network/dns

Configure DNS

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="dns">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipv4Address"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipv6Address"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainList"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<dns>
  <ipv4Address></ipv4Address>
  <ipv6Address></ipv6Address>
  <domainList></domainList>
</dns>

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

put systemTime /1.0/appliance-management/system/timesettings

Configure time or specify the NTP server to use for time synchronization

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="timeSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ntpServer">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="string"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datetime"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timezone"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<timeSettings>
  <ntpServer>
    <string></string>
  </ntpServer>
  <datetime></datetime>
  <timezone></timezone>
</timeSettings>

applianceMgrBackupSettings /backuprestore/backupsettings get put delete

Appliance Manager backup settings

get

Retrieve backup settings

put

Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

delete

Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

get applianceMgrBackupSettings /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Retrieve backup settings

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

put applianceMgrBackupSettings /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="backupRestoreSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ftpSettings">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="transferProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostNameIPAddress"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="backupDirectory"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="filenamePrefix"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passiveMode"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="useEPRT"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="useEPSV"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="backupFrequency">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="frequency"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dayOfWeek"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hourOfDay"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minuteOfHour"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeTables">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="excludeTable"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<backupRestoreSettings>
  <ftpSettings>
    <transferProtocol></transferProtocol>
    <hostNameIPAddress></hostNameIPAddress>
    <port></port>
    <userName></userName>
    <password></password>
    <backupDirectory></backupDirectory>
    <filenamePrefix></filenamePrefix>
    <passiveMode></passiveMode>
    <useEPRT></useEPRT>
    <useEPSV></useEPSV>
  </ftpSettings>
  <backupFrequency>
    <frequency></frequency>
    <dayOfWeek></dayOfWeek>
    <hourOfDay></hourOfDay>
    <minuteOfHour></minuteOfHour>
  </backupFrequency>
  <excludeTables>
    <excludeTable></excludeTable>
  </excludeTables>
</backupRestoreSettings>
Secured by basic

delete applianceMgrBackupSettings /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

  • pageSize: (string - default: 256)

    optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

Secured by basic

nwfabric

Network virtualization components

nwfabricConfig /configure post put delete

Network virtualization components

post

You install the network infrastructure components in your virtual environment on a per‐cluster level for each vCenter server, which deploys the required software on all hosts in the cluster. This software is also referred to as an NSX vSwitch. When a new host is added to this cluster, the required software is automatically installed on the newly added host. After the network infrastructure is installed on a cluster, Logical Firewall is enabled on that cluster.

put

This API call can be used to upgrade network virtualization components. After NSX Manager is upgraded, previously prepared clusters must have the 6.x network virtualization components installed.

delete

Removes previously installed VIBs, tears down NSX manager to ESX messaging, and remove any other network fabric dependent features like logical wires etc. If a feature like logical wire is being used in your environment, this call fails.

post nwfabricConfig /2.0/nwfabric/configure

You install the network infrastructure components in your virtual environment on a per‐cluster level for each vCenter server, which deploys the required software on all hosts in the cluster. This software is also referred to as an NSX vSwitch. When a new host is added to this cluster, the required software is automatically installed on the newly added host. After the network infrastructure is installed on a cluster, Logical Firewall is enabled on that cluster.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • action: (string)

    Resets communication between NSX Manager and a host or cluster. The resourceId is the ID of the cluster or host that is retrieved from the vCenter managed object browser. Set to "synchronize" to reset communication.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId></featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>
Secured by basic

put nwfabricConfig /2.0/nwfabric/configure

This API call can be used to upgrade network virtualization components. After NSX Manager is upgraded, previously prepared clusters must have the 6.x network virtualization components installed.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId></featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>
Secured by basic

delete nwfabricConfig /2.0/nwfabric/configure

Removes previously installed VIBs, tears down NSX manager to ESX messaging, and remove any other network fabric dependent features like logical wires etc. If a feature like logical wire is being used in your environment, this call fails.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId></featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>
Secured by basic

Deploy security fabric

Upgrade service to recent version

post securityFabric /2.0/si/deploy

Deploy security fabric

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • startTime: (string)

    Time to start deployment task. If not specified, deploy immediately

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfigs">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clusterId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastore"/>
              <xs:element name="services">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="serviceDeploymentConfig">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvPortGroup"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPool"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<clusterDeploymentConfigs>
  <clusterDeploymentConfig>
    <clusterId></clusterId>
    <datastore></datastore>
    <services>
      <serviceDeploymentConfig>
        <serviceId></serviceId>
        <dvPortGroup></dvPortGroup>
        <ipPool></ipPool>
      </serviceDeploymentConfig>
    </services>
  </clusterDeploymentConfig>
</clusterDeploymentConfigs>
Secured by basic

put securityFabric /2.0/si/deploy

Upgrade service to recent version

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • startTime: (string)

    optional; specify time to start upgrade

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfigs">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clusterId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastore"/>
              <xs:element name="services">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="serviceDeploymentConfig">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceInstanceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvPortGroup"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPool"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<clusterDeploymentConfigs>
  <clusterDeploymentConfig>
    <clusterId></clusterId>
    <datastore></datastore>
    <services>
      <serviceDeploymentConfig>
        <serviceId></serviceId>
        <serviceInstanceId></serviceInstanceId>
        <dvPortGroup></dvPortGroup>
        <ipPool></ipPool>
      </serviceDeploymentConfig>
    </services>
  </clusterDeploymentConfig>
</clusterDeploymentConfigs>

  • Security

URI Parameters

  • clusterID: required (string)

    Cluster ID

  • Security

  • clusterID: required (string)

    Cluster ID

Query Parameters

    Comma-separated list of service id's to specify which services to uninstall

  • startTime: (string)

    Time for uninstall to be scheduled. If not specified, do immediately

Enable one or more regulations by putting the regulation IDs into the policy. You can get the IDs from the output of the dlpRegulation GET call

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="set">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="long"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

put

Configure a customized regex as a classification value

put dlpRegexClassificationValue /2.0/dlp/policy/classificationvalues

Configure a customized regex as a classification value

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="set">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ClassificationValue">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element name="classification">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="providerName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="customizable"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<set>
  <ClassificationValue>
    <id></id>
    <classification>
      <id></id>
      <name></name>
      <providerName></providerName>
      <description></description>
      <customizable></customizable>
    </classification>
    <value></value>
  </ClassificationValue>
</set>

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ID: required (string)

    Limit filter results by VC MOID of datacenter, cluster, or resource pool

Query Parameters

  • scanstatus: (string)

    Specify scan status of vm's to be retrieved (all|notstarted|started|completed)

  • pagesize: (string - default: 256)

    Limit max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

  • startindex: (string)

    Specify starting point for retrieving logs

eventControl

eventControl Operations

dataCollectionVM /vm/{vmID}/request post

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

post

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

post dataCollectionVM /1.0/eventcontrol/vm/{vmID}/request

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vmID: required (string)

    MOID of the guest vm

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="perVmConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="actions">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<perVmConfig>
  <actions>
    <action>
      <type></type>
      <value></value>
    </action>
  </actions>
</perVmConfig>
Secured by basic

dataCollectionKillSwitch /eventcontrol-root/request post

Data collection kill switch on/off

post

Turn on/off data collection at global level

post dataCollectionKillSwitch /1.0/eventcontrol/eventcontrol-root/request

Turn on/off data collection at global level

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="request">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="actions">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<request>
  <actions>
    <action>
      <type></type>
      <value></value>
    </action>
  </actions>
</request>
Secured by basic

activityMonitoring

Activity monitoring

userActivity /records get

Get aggregated user activity (action records) using parameters. Requires vShield Endpoint and NSX Endpoint configured, and Data collection enabled on 1+ vm's

get

Get aggregated user activity

get userActivity /3.0/ai/records

Get aggregated user activity

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • query: required (string - default: resource)

    Name of report (resource,adg,containers,sam,vma)

  • interval: required (string)

    Relative time to current time (number followed by either m,h,d,s)

    Example:

    60m
  • stime: (string - default: 2012-02-28T21:00)

    Start time for query

  • etime: (string - default: 2012-02-29T21:00)

    End time for query

  • param: (string - default: src:SECURITY_GROUP:1:INCLUDE)

    Parameter to be applied to query (:::operator)

  • pagesize: (string - default: 1000)

    Number of records to retrieve (recommended between 100-2000)

  • startindex: (string - default: 100)

    Start record number for pagination

Secured by basic

userDetails /userdetails get

Retrieve user detail records in accordance with given query parameters

get userDetails /3.0/ai/userdetails

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • query: required (string - default: resource)

    Name of report (resource,adg,containers,sam,vma)

  • interval: required (string)

    Relative time to current time (number followed by either m,h,d,s)

    Example:

    60m
  • stime: (string - default: 2012-02-28T21:00)

    Start time for query

  • etime: (string - default: 2012-02-29T21:00)

    End time for query

  • param: (string - default: src:SECURITY_GROUP:1:INCLUDE)

    Parameter to be applied to query (:::operator)

  • pagesize: (string - default: 1000)

    Number of records to retrieve (recommended between 100-2000)

  • startindex: (string - default: 100)

    Start record number for pagination

domain

Working with domains

domain /3.0/directory/updateDomain post

post

Register or update a domain with NSX Manager

post domain /3.0/directory/updateDomain

Register or update a domain with NSX Manager

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="DirectoryDomain">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netbiosName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="username"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<DirectoryDomain>
  <name></name>
  <type></type>
  <netbiosName></netbiosName>
  <username></username>
  <password></password>
</DirectoryDomain>
Secured by basic

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="username"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <domainId></domainId>
  <hostName></hostName>
  <enabled></enabled>

macset

Operations on an individual MACset

macset /2.0/services/macset/{macsetId} get put delete

get

Retrieve details about a MACset

put

Modify an existing MACset

delete

Delete a MACset

get macset /2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Retrieve details about a MACset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • macsetId: required (string)

    Specified MACset ID (Can be retrieved by listing the MACset on a scope)

Secured by basic

put macset /2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Modify an existing MACset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • macsetId: required (string)

    Specified MACset ID (Can be retrieved by listing the MACset on a scope)

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="macset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<macset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</macset>
Secured by basic

delete macset /2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Delete a MACset

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • macsetId: required (string)

    Specified MACset ID (Can be retrieved by listing the MACset on a scope)

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean)

    Indicates forced or unforced delete. With forced delete, the object is deleted even if used in other places such as firewall rules, causing invalid referrals. For unforced delete, the object is deleted only if it is no used by other configurations; otherwise the delete fails

Secured by basic

macsetScopes

Working with MAC Sets.

macsetScopes /2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId} post get

post

Create a MACset on a specified scope

get

List MACsets created on a specified scope

post macsetScopes /2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId}

Create a MACset on a specified scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases. Universal MAC sets are read-only from secondary managers.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="macset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<macset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</macset>
Secured by basic

get macsetScopes /2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId}

List MACsets created on a specified scope

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases. Universal MAC sets are read-only from secondary managers.

Secured by basic

taskFramework

Working with filtering criteria and paging information for jobs on the task framework

taskFramework /2.0/services/taskservice/job get

get

Query job instances by criterion

get taskFramework /2.0/services/taskservice/job

Query job instances by criterion

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • startIndex: (integer)

    Start index (0 by default)

  • pageSize: (integer)

    Page size (10 by default)

  • sortBy: (string)

    Always sorted by "startTime"

  • sortOrderAscending: (boolean)

    Sort in ascending order of start time (true/false)

Secured by basic

  • Security

    Specified job Id

post

Register a vendor

post vShield /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration

Register a vendor

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="VendorInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="title"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<VendorInfo>
  <id></id>
  <title></title>
  <description></description>
</VendorInfo>
Secured by basic

vShieldVendorsInfo /vendors get

Registration status of vShield vendors

get

Retrieve the list of all registered vendors

get vShieldVendorsInfo /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/vendors

Retrieve the list of all registered vendors

Secured by basic
  • Security
Secured by basic

vShieldSolution /{vendorID} post get delete

Antivirus solutions

post

Register an antivirus solution

get

Get vendor registration information

delete

Unregister a vendor

post vShieldSolution /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}

Register an antivirus solution

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vendorID: required (string)

    VMware-assigned ID for the vendor

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="SolutionInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="altitude"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="title"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<SolutionInfo>
  <altitude></altitude>
  <title></title>
  <description></description>
</SolutionInfo>
Secured by basic

vShieldSolutionInfo /{altitude} get delete

Solution registration information

get

Get registration information for a given solution

delete

Unregister a solution

get vShieldSolutionInfo /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}

Get registration information for a given solution

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vendorID: required (string)

    VMware-assigned ID for the vendor

  • altitude: required (string)

    VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host

Secured by basic

delete vShieldSolutionInfo /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}

Unregister a solution

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vendorID: required (string)

    VMware-assigned ID for the vendor

  • altitude: required (string)

    VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host

Secured by basic

solutionIPPort /location post delete

IP address and port for a solution

post

Set a solution's IP address and port on the vNIC host

delete

Unset a solution's IP address and port

post solutionIPPort /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}/location

Set a solution's IP address and port on the vNIC host

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vendorID: required (string)

    VMware-assigned ID for the vendor

  • altitude: required (string)

    VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="LocationInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<LocationInfo>
  <ip></ip>
  <port></port>
</LocationInfo>
Secured by basic

delete solutionIPPort /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}/location

Unset a solution's IP address and port

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vendorID: required (string)

    VMware-assigned ID for the vendor

  • altitude: required (string)

    VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host

Secured by basic

  • altitude: required (string)

    VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host

    managed object reference
